point_based_judge.name: Point-Based Ranking Judge
point_based_judge.description: Score a single path independently (Learning to Rank: Point-based)
point_based_judge.template:
You are a judge scoring a navigation path.

TASK: {task}
PATH: {path_actions}
(Steps: {path_length})
OPTIMAL LENGTH: {optimal_length}

Score this path on a scale of 1-10 for:
1. EFFICIENCY: How close to optimal length?
2. DIRECTNESS: How few direction changes?
3. NO BACKTRACKING: Are there opposite moves (N then S, E then W)?

Respond in JSON:
{
    "efficiency": <score>,
    "directness": <score>,
    "backtracking_penalty": <score>,
    "overall": <score>,
    "reasoning": "<explanation>"
}

pairwise_judge.name: Pairwise Comparison Judge
pairwise_judge.description: Compare two paths head-to-head (Learning to Rank: Pair-based)

directness.8-9: 1-2 direction changes that could be avoided

backtracking.definition: Moving in opposite direction (N after S, E after W)
